sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
Find the rank of the matrix

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 3 & 5 \\
2 & 6 & 10 \\
-1 & -3 & -5 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$
message_2:
To find the rank of the matrix, we need to perform Gaussian elimination to bring it to its row-echelon form and then count the number of non-zero rows.

Let's perform Gaussian elimination:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 3 & 5 \\
2 & 6 & 10 \\
-1 & -3 & -5 \\
\end{bmatrix}
\rightarrow
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 3 & 5 \\
0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 0 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

We can see that the matrix has been reduced to its row-echelon form. Now, we count the number of non-zero rows:

There is only 1 non-zero row in the row-echelon form of the matrix. Therefore, the rank of the matrix is 1.
